CDC-2025-0024-1083 2025-06-18 Comment from Bowles , Tammy
Support for Removing COVID-19 Vaccines From the Market Support for Disclosing Conflicts of Interest and Transparency
 None ACIP ‚Äì Want to Regain the Public‚Äôs Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:1 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The comment clearly advocates for the removal of all licensed COVID vaccines from the market due to concerns about safety and the number of reported deaths. Additionally, it demands rigorous research standards for all vaccines, indicating a call for greater transparency and accountability in vaccine licensing.

Support for Strong Vaccine Recommendations for Vulnerable Groups
 None I am 78 years old and grew up in the era before a lot of the vaccines were available, things like measles, mumps, rubella and polio. I can remember our class going to visit a child in an iron lung. I had a friend that was crippled in her legs by polio. When I got the measles my mom made me stay ... 1 1:1 Vaccines have been a blessing. The commenter reflects positively on vaccines and their impact, emphasizing their importance in preventing serious diseases and implying support for vaccination as a necessary measure for public health. The detailed personal history underscores the value of vaccines in protecting the vulnerable and preventing past health crises.

The commenter expresses strong opposition to the removal of the ACIP members and supports their expertise in vaccine safety and efficacy. Additionally, it expresses concern about the potential consequences of not having updated COVID-19 vaccines, suggesting opposition to removing access to these vaccines.
